page.title: 11LOCHGOILHEAD-TRANSPORT(2)
page.content: The narrow roads into the village are sometimes blocked with snow whoch disrupts bread and milk deliveries. If the roads remain blocked for several days bread,milk,etc. are brought to the village by boat.In case of a medical emergency in bad weather a helicopter is used to take the sick person to hospital. The Royal Navy,which has a base at Douglas Pier,just outside the village,contributes greatly to the traffic using the loch as do the many pleasure craft. The remnants of the old pier and the surrounding huts at Pierhead are all that remain of the days when the steamers were the main form of transport.The only steamer which visits the loch is the Waverley but it does not stop.
